      • getAbsolutePath

        public static java.lang.String getAbsolutePath(java.lang.String path,
                               java.lang.String rootPath)
        A path is absolute if it begins with a "/" or a "\" or a drive letter ":". The path will have the \ directory seperators replaces with /. This method returns absolute paths as-is. Relative paths are prepended with the root application directory.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the directory or file, eithor absolute or relative
        rootPath - the path to the rootDirectory, if path is relative
        Returns:
        the absolute path to the

        Parameters:

        Returns:
